intro: Helianthella californica subsp. shastensis, commonly known as Shasta helianthella, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its basal rosette of gray-green, woolly leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. This subspecies is notable for its drought tolerance and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
